data.title: FRIENDS BIRTHS, MARRIAGES & DEATHS, 1724
data.text:
July 1914. Note: The eastern section of Yorktown, New York, still bears the name of Amawalk, New York, probably an abbreviation and corruption of the Mohegan term Appamaghpogh, which had been applied to the whole Indian territory within the Manor, west of Cortland Town, and it was under this name on 24 Aug 1683 that the grant was made to Stephanns VAN CORTLAND of New York City, from the Indian sachems Powemine, Oskewans, Turham, Querawighint, Siecham, Isighers & Prackises. Yorktown, New York, was formerly called Hanover, from a part of it Stephenstown was set off 7 Mar 1788; and in 1808, it became Somers, New York.

Amawalk, Westchester County, New York, Friend's Monthly Meeting Records : beginning before the separation caused by the preaching of Elias HICKS, and have since been kept in the hands of the Amawalk Orthodox Friend's. This copy made from the tow books in Jun 1908 in possession of Mr. Jacob McKEEL, of Yorktown Heights, Westchester County, New York, the secretary being a Mr. KEAR.

Marriages, Oct 1798 per Oct 1868; 80 couples

[Transcriber's note:-- unless otherwise indicated, all towns are in Westchester Co., NY --jd]

[Transcriber's note:-- material enclosed in brackets ( ) appears to be from some other source than the Friends' Records --jd]

The latest birth is Gertrude MEKEEL, 29-1 m-1872

The oldest death is Henry GRIFFEN, 1808

The latest death is Richard WEEKS, 1-3 m-1908

Justus BROWN Bible, 1749-1847

Received from Mr. Charles Alvan HOAG, Pleasantville, Westchester Co., New York. This Brown Family were Friends and resided for a time in North Castle, Westchester County, New York; it is included here because many of the preceding Amawalk Familes also lived in North Castle and it would seem this BROWN family must also belong here.

Justus BROWN born at North Castle, Westchester Co., New York, 5-8m-174_ (9?); d. at Queensbury, Warren Co., New York, 30-4m-1835, ae 86-1-25; married 3-12m-1775 Desire MOSHUR, b. 12-3m-1750, New Bedford, Mass., d. Queensbury, New York, 23-7m-1822, ae 65-4-11.

The names of their children - ten of them -

Stephen, b. 21-3m-1778

Deborah, b. 24-8m-1780; d. 20-11m-1804

Lydia, b. 10-12m-1782

Hannah, b. 10-6m-1785, d. 22-2m-1847

Abigail, b. 19-6m-1787

Benjamin, b. 15-4m-1789

Richard, b. 19-7m-1791

David, b. 12-3m-1794

Anna D., b. 15-3m-1797

Justus, Jr., b. 15-7m-1800

Justus SHERMAN, b. 10-11m-1804, and was drowned in Lake Erie, 9-8m-1847, ae 37-2-26

Deborah SHERMAN, formerly BROWN, was b. in Dutchess Co., New York; d. at Queensbury, Warren Co., New York, 20-11m-1804

Hannah BROWN, was b. at Queensbury, New York, and d. at Batten, Warren Co., New York, the 22nd, of 2nd mo., 1847, ae 61 yrs, 7 mos, 27 dys

(Signed) Jedidah HOAG

Ellery, New York, 21 Jun 1874
